programme.title: The King's Man
programme.desc: (2021) The spy-caper franchise continues with the origins story of the Kingsman agency, as a plucky group battle an international conspiracy at the outbreak of WWI. With Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: A Quiet Place

programme.title: Press Preview

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance 2024
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr host the gala evening at the Royal Albert Hall, in the presence of King Charles. Featuring the cast of Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical Starlight Express, magicians Penn & Teller and Britain's Got Talent winner Sydnie Christmas, as well as Sophie Ellis-Bextor, James Bay and Eurovision 2024 winner Nemo

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September of this year, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: The King
programme.desc: His Majesty Charles III delivers his annual Christmas message to the nation and the Commonwealth

programme.title: Ainsley's Festive Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by Brian Conley, Rosemary Shrager, Katherine Ryan and Olly Smith for a festive feast for the whole family to enjoy including a cheeseboard fig tart, Korean-inspired turkey burgers, a pastry domed vegetable pie and a spiced chocolate espresso rumtini mousse

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Mariah Carey: Merry Christmas to All
programme.desc: The singer-songwriter performs a repertoire of her festive holiday hits, including the chart-topping favourite 'All I Want for Christmas Is You'.

programme.title: James Martin's Christmas Day
programme.desc: The chef invites Lorraine Kelly, Craig David and Luke Evans into his home for a festive feast put together by himself, Lise Goodwin-Allen and Richard Bertinet that includes langoustines, monk fish, choux pastry, chicken Diane, rum babas and the ultimate Christmas cheeseboard. Plus, music by Marti Pellow

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring George Lazenby, Diana Rigg and Telly Savalas. James Bond resigns from the Secret Service in order to continue his relentless quest to track down arch villain Blofeld. A liaison with a beautiful but wilful playgirl leads Bond to a notorious criminal who helps him track his quarry to a mountain hideaway in Switzerland.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the King George VI Chase from Kempton Park. Plus, the Rowland Meyrick Chase from Wetherby and the Formby Hurdle from Aintree. With analysis from AP McCoy, Mick Fitzgerald and Ruby Walsh, reports from Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Musical based on the hit stage show, starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John. Unexpectedly reunited with summer love Danny at her new high school, Sandy Olsson can't believe how different he is. Can the new Danny Zuko, the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-birds, really be the boy she met down at the beach? Perhaps Frenchy and Rizzo, both members of the super-cool Pink Ladies gang, can help her develop some street cred to win back his heart.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show where two teams of three players compete against each other trying to guess the correct word or phrase represented by the drawings of their team-mates. Mel is joined by Jeff Brazier and Scarlett Moffatt as the players draw and their team members guess

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon struggles, there is trouble at Home Farm, and Cain sets aside his worries

programme.title: The Masked Singer: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Four celebrities compete undercover in elaborate costumes, keeping their true identities hidden. Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders, Jonathan Ross and Mo Gilligan try to guess the identities of Christmas Cracker, Star, Turkey Crown and Nutcracker. Joel Dommett hosts

programme.title: The 1% Club Christmas Special
programme.desc: Festive edition of Lee Mack's quiz, in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin the show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Bruce Willis. When a rogue former government agent threatens to bring the United States computer infrastructure to its knees, it falls to cop John McClane and a young hacker to prevent potential disaster. But can the mix of old-school, tough-guy policing and modern computer expertise foil a group that will stop at nothing?

programme.title: Gallagher Premiership Unleashed
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, featuring Gloucester v Harlequins, Leicester Tigers v Bristol Bears, Newcastle Falcons v Bath, Sale Sharks v Exeter Chiefs and Saracens v Northampton Saints

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Festive Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by Brian Conley, Rosemary Shrager, Katherine Ryan and Olly Smith for a festive feast for the whole family to enjoy including a cheeseboard fig tart, Korean-inspired turkey burgers, a pastry domed vegetable pie and a spiced chocolate espresso rumtini mousse

programme.title: The Masked Singer: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Four celebrities compete undercover in elaborate costumes, keeping their true identities hidden. Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders, Jonathan Ross and Mo Gilligan try to guess the identities of Christmas Cracker, Star, Turkey Crown and Nutcracker. Joel Dommett hosts

programme.title: Evan Almighty
programme.desc: Comedy fantasy sequel starring Steve Carell and Morgan Freeman. Newsman Evan Baxter is newly elected to Congress on a "Save the World" ticket and trying to ignore God's instruction to build an ark. Forced to comply after the Almighty transforms him into a modern-day Noah, Baxter sets out to convince everyone of impending disaster.

programme.title: Big
programme.desc: Comedy starring Tom Hanks. At a fairground fortune-telling booth, 12-year-old Josh Baskin wishes that he could be "big". The next morning he is astonished to find himself fully grown. He soon learns that, in the adult world, being a grown-up is not all that it is cracked up to be.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of two meetings, including the Desert Orchid from Kempton Park and the Welsh Grand National from Chepstow. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Matt Chapman, Sally Ann Grassick and Luke Harvey, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Jurassic Park
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's blockbuster adventure, starring Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum and Richard Attenborough. Billionaire tycoon John Hammond has built the ultimate theme park - an island populated by genetically engineered dinosaurs. A group of guests, including Hammond's grandchildren, are invited to preview the attraction, touring the park in remotely controlled cars. But, as a tropical storm gathers, an unscrupulous employee shuts down the elaborate security system, leaving the tour stranded - and mayhem about to break loose.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: The Big Quiz: Coronation Street v Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sally Lindsay steps into Stephen Mulhern's shoes to host the annual clash between ITV's biggest soaps. Coronation Street team captain Jack P Shepherd (David Platt) is joined by Samia Longchambon (Maria Connor) and Vinta Morgan (Ronnie Bailey) to take on Emmerdale's Beth Cordingly (Ruby Fox-Miligan), Rebecca Sarker (Manpreet Sharma) and captain Mark Charnock (Marlon Dingle). Teams play rounds that test their knowledge of the past year in soap, guess missing words in You Must Be Blanking, and rummage around in Sally's Soap Box full of props to work out memorable storylines

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ross and Marlon find themselves in danger, Ruby is suspicious, and Lydia is worried

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Amy provides a vital clue when Nick seeks proof of Leanne setting him up, Ken and Cassie swap belated presents, and a newly confident Bethany retrieves her old clothes from Daisy

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: The return of the quiz in which contestants from across the UK take on a team consisting of Paul 'The Sinnerman' Sinha, Jenny 'The Vixen' Ryan, Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty, Shaun 'The Dark Destroyer' Wallace, Mark 'The Beast' Labbett and Darragh 'The Menace' Ennis hoping to win big money. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: Tsunami: The Wave That Shook the World
programme.desc: Documentary examining the 2004 Indian Ocean Boxing Day tsunami. Killing around 230,000 people and displacing 1.4 million more, it was one of the deadliest natural disasters in history. Told through the first-hand experiences of individuals from all over the world, cameras reveal how catastrophic events unfolded during the morning of December 26, 2004. Among them is Rob, an Englishman who conveys the horrifying account of his desperate attempts to rescue his family from a paradise beach in Sri Lanka

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Katy Perry: Night of a Lifetime
programme.desc: The American singer-songwriter hosts a spectacular evening of music and conversation from London's Central Hall Westminster. Watched by a star-studded audience, Katy performs a selection of her greatest hits as well as songs from her latest album, 143

programme.title: TikTok: Top 100 2024
programme.desc: A countdown of the top 100 funniest, most extreme and rudest viral videos of 2024 from TikTok and other social media platforms. Plus, an estimation of how much money the clips made for their creators

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the doors of British factories to find out how they keep shelves stocked, from massive factories making meals in their millions to family firms trading on secret recipes. The first edition celebrates snacks, visiting the Wagon Wheel factory in south Wales making millions of biscuits a year and the Melton Mowbray company responsible for an award-winning pork pie. Plus, how potatoes are taken from the field and turned into crisps in a matter of hours

programme.title: Love Your Exotic Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh takes a look back at memorable exotic gardens created by his team, and the unusual twists the show has put on a challenge. The three projects featured in this special are a tranquil Japanese garden, a Moroccan oasis, and a theatrical Italian masterpiece

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Christmas has well and truly arrived at Manor Farm and bringing the festive cheer are actress Anita Dobson, actor Ben Miller and broadcaster Moira Stuart - with Andy Clarke providing the best in Christmas cocktails. Horticulturist Camilla Bassett-Smith celebrates the season Victorian-style, there is a look at how the animals at Port Lympne and Howletts Zoo spend the big day and Alan meets some special Shetland ponies

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning at Christmas
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen for the final time in 2024 as the festive celebrations continue with guests Russell Watson and Kim Wilde, chefs Paul Ainsworth and Pip Lacey, and master cocktail maker Merlin Griffiths

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner revisit favourite recipes from the show's last few years, starting with brunch dishes of a takeaway-inspired egg and sausage muffin, and chorizo and broken yolk smash. That's followed by two simple traybakes of a haddock and sweetcorn chowder, and a beans and waffle pie, then a veggie lasagne, and beef chow mein with prawn crackers. They finish up with two sweet treats - Lisa's honey and coconut cake and a decadent burnt Basque cheesecake

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: Comedy starring John Candy and Macaulay Culkin. Buck Russell is a fun-loving bachelor without a care in the world. He's also the world's greatest slob. So when he has to look after his sharp young nephew and nieces while their parents are away, anything can - and will - happen.

programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure starring Jeff Goldblum and Julianne Moore. Past experience tells Dr Ian Malcolm not to get involved with businessman John Hammond's new scheme to build a dinosaur park. However, he reluctantly agrees when he realises that his girlfriend is already on site. On his arrival on the secluded island he soon finds that his fears were well founded.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Britain Get Singing
programme.desc: A second outing for the show in which Roman Kemp invites celebrities to take part in a spectacular sing-off while shining a light on mental health. Groups from Good Morning Britain, Love Island, Coronation Street, EastEnders and The Masked Singer compete, with the likes of Kate Garraway, Laura Tobin, Claire Sweeney, Mollie Gallagher, Chris Kamara, Russell Watson, Emma Barton, Heather Peace and Sid Owen performing for a super panel of Will.i.am, Adam Lambert, Alesha Dixon and Jonathan Ross

programme.title: What's on Scotland at Christmas
programme.desc: Festive showbiz fun with celebrity interviews and a guide to the best in seasonal entertainment

programme.title: Deal or No Deal: Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as heptathlete Katarina Johnson-Thompson goes up against the infamous banker - supported by her friends, family and fellow athletes. Can Katarina choose the right boxes and resist the banker's tempting cash offers until just the right moment in order to take home a fortune for her chosen charity?

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune Christmas Special
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts a special festive edition of the classic game show, with actor Richard E Grant, Gavin & Stacey star Joanna Page and TV and radio presenter Tyler West spinning the wheel and trying to solve puzzles and avoid bankruptcy in the hope of winning 50,000 for the charities of their choice

programme.title: Lorraine Kelly: 40 Unforgettable Years
programme.desc: A tribute to the much-loved presenter and journalist who joined TV-am in October 1984, and became one of British TV's most popular broadcasters. Featuring archival footage from Lorraine's early broadcasting career to the present day and interviews with those who know her best

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Downton Abbey: A New Era
programme.desc: Period drama sequel starring Hugh Bonneville, Elizabeth McGovern and Maggie Smith. It's 1928, and Downton Abbey has been chosen as the setting for a new silent film, much to the excitement of the staff. Meanwhile, the Crawleys set off for the South of France, where the Dowager Countess is set to come into possession of a glamorous villa.

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Christmas has well and truly arrived at Manor Farm and bringing the festive cheer are actress Anita Dobson, actor Ben Miller and broadcaster Moira Stuart - with Andy Clarke providing the best in Christmas cocktails. Horticulturist Camilla Bassett-Smith celebrates the season Victorian-style, there is a look at how the animals at Port Lympne and Howletts Zoo spend the big day and Alan meets some special Shetland ponies

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning at Christmas
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen for the final time in 2024 as the festive celebrations continue with guests Russell Watson and Kim Wilde, chefs Paul Ainsworth and Pip Lacey, and master cocktail maker Merlin Griffiths

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner revisit favourite recipes from the show's last few years, starting with brunch dishes of a takeaway-inspired egg and sausage muffin, and chorizo and broken yolk smash. That's followed by two simple traybakes of a haddock and sweetcorn chowder, and a beans and waffle pie, then a veggie lasagne, and beef chow mein with prawn crackers. They finish up with two sweet treats - Lisa's honey and coconut cake and a decadent burnt Basque cheesecake

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: Comedy starring John Candy and Macaulay Culkin. Buck Russell is a fun-loving bachelor without a care in the world. He's also the world's greatest slob. So when he has to look after his sharp young nephew and nieces while their parents are away, anything can - and will - happen.

programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure starring Jeff Goldblum and Julianne Moore. Past experience tells Dr Ian Malcolm not to get involved with businessman John Hammond's new scheme to build a dinosaur park. However, he reluctantly agrees when he realises that his girlfriend is already on site. On his arrival on the secluded island he soon finds that his fears were well founded.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Britain Get Singing
programme.desc: A second outing for the show in which Roman Kemp invites celebrities to take part in a spectacular sing-off while shining a light on mental health. Groups from Good Morning Britain, Love Island, Coronation Street, EastEnders and The Masked Singer compete, with the likes of Kate Garraway, Laura Tobin, Claire Sweeney, Mollie Gallagher, Chris Kamara, Russell Watson, Emma Barton, Heather Peace and Sid Owen performing for a super panel of Will.i.am, Adam Lambert, Alesha Dixon and Jonathan Ross

programme.title: What's on Scotland at Christmas
programme.desc: Festive showbiz fun with celebrity interviews and a guide to the best in seasonal entertainment

programme.title: Deal or No Deal: Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as heptathlete Katarina Johnson-Thompson goes up against the infamous banker - supported by her friends, family and fellow athletes. Can Katarina choose the right boxes and resist the banker's tempting cash offers until just the right moment in order to take home a fortune for her chosen charity?

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune Christmas Special
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts a special festive edition of the classic game show, with actor Richard E Grant, Gavin & Stacey star Joanna Page and TV and radio presenter Tyler West spinning the wheel and trying to solve puzzles and avoid bankruptcy in the hope of winning 50,000 for the charities of their choice

programme.title: Lorraine Kelly: 40 Unforgettable Years
programme.desc: A tribute to the much-loved presenter and journalist who joined TV-am in October 1984, and became one of British TV's most popular broadcasters. Featuring archival footage from Lorraine's early broadcasting career to the present day and interviews with those who know her best

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance 2024
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr host the gala evening at the Royal Albert Hall, in the presence of King Charles. Featuring the cast of Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical Starlight Express, magicians Penn & Teller and Britain's Got Talent winner Sydnie Christmas, as well as Sophie Ellis-Bextor, James Bay and Eurovision 2024 winner Nemo

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September of this year, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: The King
programme.desc: His Majesty Charles III delivers his annual Christmas message to the nation and the Commonwealth

programme.title: Ainsley's Festive Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by Brian Conley, Rosemary Shrager, Katherine Ryan and Olly Smith for a festive feast for the whole family to enjoy including a cheeseboard fig tart, Korean-inspired turkey burgers, a pastry domed vegetable pie and a spiced chocolate espresso rumtini mousse

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Mariah Carey: Merry Christmas to All
programme.desc: The singer-songwriter performs a repertoire of her festive holiday hits, including the chart-topping favourite 'All I Want for Christmas Is You'.

programme.title: James Martin's Christmas Day
programme.desc: The chef invites Lorraine Kelly, Craig David and Luke Evans into his home for a festive feast put together by himself, Lise Goodwin-Allen and Richard Bertinet that includes langoustines, monk fish, choux pastry, chicken Diane, rum babas and the ultimate Christmas cheeseboard. Plus, music by Marti Pellow

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring George Lazenby, Diana Rigg and Telly Savalas. James Bond resigns from the Secret Service in order to continue his relentless quest to track down arch villain Blofeld. A liaison with a beautiful but wilful playgirl leads Bond to a notorious criminal who helps him track his quarry to a mountain hideaway in Switzerland.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the King George VI Chase from Kempton Park. Plus, the Rowland Meyrick Chase from Wetherby and the Formby Hurdle from Aintree. With analysis from AP McCoy, Mick Fitzgerald and Ruby Walsh, reports from Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Musical based on the hit stage show, starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John. Unexpectedly reunited with summer love Danny at her new high school, Sandy Olsson can't believe how different he is. Can the new Danny Zuko, the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-birds, really be the boy she met down at the beach? Perhaps Frenchy and Rizzo, both members of the super-cool Pink Ladies gang, can help her develop some street cred to win back his heart.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show where two teams of three players compete against each other trying to guess the correct word or phrase represented by the drawings of their team-mates. Mel is joined by Jeff Brazier and Scarlett Moffatt as the players draw and their team members guess

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon struggles, there is trouble at Home Farm, and Cain sets aside his worries

programme.title: The Masked Singer: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Four celebrities compete undercover in elaborate costumes, keeping their true identities hidden. Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders, Jonathan Ross and Mo Gilligan try to guess the identities of Christmas Cracker, Star, Turkey Crown and Nutcracker. Joel Dommett hosts

programme.title: The 1% Club Christmas Special
programme.desc: Festive edition of Lee Mack's quiz, in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin the show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Bruce Willis. When a rogue former government agent threatens to bring the United States computer infrastructure to its knees, it falls to cop John McClane and a young hacker to prevent potential disaster. But can the mix of old-school, tough-guy policing and modern computer expertise foil a group that will stop at nothing?

programme.title: Gallagher Premiership Unleashed
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, featuring Gloucester v Harlequins, Leicester Tigers v Bristol Bears, Newcastle Falcons v Bath, Sale Sharks v Exeter Chiefs and Saracens v Northampton Saints

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Festive Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by Brian Conley, Rosemary Shrager, Katherine Ryan and Olly Smith for a festive feast for the whole family to enjoy including a cheeseboard fig tart, Korean-inspired turkey burgers, a pastry domed vegetable pie and a spiced chocolate espresso rumtini mousse

programme.title: The Masked Singer: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Four celebrities compete undercover in elaborate costumes, keeping their true identities hidden. Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders, Jonathan Ross and Mo Gilligan try to guess the identities of Christmas Cracker, Star, Turkey Crown and Nutcracker. Joel Dommett hosts

programme.title: Evan Almighty
programme.desc: Comedy fantasy sequel starring Steve Carell and Morgan Freeman. Newsman Evan Baxter is newly elected to Congress on a "Save the World" ticket and trying to ignore God's instruction to build an ark. Forced to comply after the Almighty transforms him into a modern-day Noah, Baxter sets out to convince everyone of impending disaster.

programme.title: Big
programme.desc: Comedy starring Tom Hanks. At a fairground fortune-telling booth, 12-year-old Josh Baskin wishes that he could be "big". The next morning he is astonished to find himself fully grown. He soon learns that, in the adult world, being a grown-up is not all that it is cracked up to be.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of two meetings, including the Desert Orchid from Kempton Park and the Welsh Grand National from Chepstow. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Matt Chapman, Sally Ann Grassick and Luke Harvey, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Jurassic Park
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's blockbuster adventure, starring Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum and Richard Attenborough. Billionaire tycoon John Hammond has built the ultimate theme park - an island populated by genetically engineered dinosaurs. A group of guests, including Hammond's grandchildren, are invited to preview the attraction, touring the park in remotely controlled cars. But, as a tropical storm gathers, an unscrupulous employee shuts down the elaborate security system, leaving the tour stranded - and mayhem about to break loose.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: The Big Quiz: Coronation Street v Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sally Lindsay steps into Stephen Mulhern's shoes to host the annual clash between ITV's biggest soaps. Coronation Street team captain Jack P Shepherd (David Platt) is joined by Samia Longchambon (Maria Connor) and Vinta Morgan (Ronnie Bailey) to take on Emmerdale's Beth Cordingly (Ruby Fox-Miligan), Rebecca Sarker (Manpreet Sharma) and captain Mark Charnock (Marlon Dingle). Teams play rounds that test their knowledge of the past year in soap, guess missing words in You Must Be Blanking, and rummage around in Sally's Soap Box full of props to work out memorable storylines

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ross and Marlon find themselves in danger, Ruby is suspicious, and Lydia is worried

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Amy provides a vital clue when Nick seeks proof of Leanne setting him up, Ken and Cassie swap belated presents, and a newly confident Bethany retrieves her old clothes from Daisy

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: The return of the quiz in which contestants from across the UK take on a team consisting of Paul 'The Sinnerman' Sinha, Jenny 'The Vixen' Ryan, Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty, Shaun 'The Dark Destroyer' Wallace, Mark 'The Beast' Labbett and Darragh 'The Menace' Ennis hoping to win big money. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: Tsunami: The Wave That Shook the World
programme.desc: Documentary examining the 2004 Indian Ocean Boxing Day tsunami. Killing around 230,000 people and displacing 1.4 million more, it was one of the deadliest natural disasters in history. Told through the first-hand experiences of individuals from all over the world, cameras reveal how catastrophic events unfolded during the morning of December 26, 2004. Among them is Rob, an Englishman who conveys the horrifying account of his desperate attempts to rescue his family from a paradise beach in Sri Lanka

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Katy Perry: Night of a Lifetime
programme.desc: The American singer-songwriter hosts a spectacular evening of music and conversation from London's Central Hall Westminster. Watched by a star-studded audience, Katy performs a selection of her greatest hits as well as songs from her latest album, 143

programme.title: TikTok: Top 100 2024
programme.desc: A countdown of the top 100 funniest, most extreme and rudest viral videos of 2024 from TikTok and other social media platforms. Plus, an estimation of how much money the clips made for their creators

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the doors of British factories to find out how they keep shelves stocked, from massive factories making meals in their millions to family firms trading on secret recipes. The first edition celebrates snacks, visiting the Wagon Wheel factory in south Wales making millions of biscuits a year and the Melton Mowbray company responsible for an award-winning pork pie. Plus, how potatoes are taken from the field and turned into crisps in a matter of hours

programme.desc: Ross and Marlon find themselves in danger, Ruby is suspicious, and Lydia is worried

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Amy provides a vital clue when Nick seeks proof of Leanne setting him up, Ken and Cassie swap belated presents, and a newly confident Bethany retrieves her old clothes from Daisy

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: The return of the quiz in which contestants from across the UK take on a team consisting of Paul 'The Sinnerman' Sinha, Jenny 'The Vixen' Ryan, Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty, Shaun 'The Dark Destroyer' Wallace, Mark 'The Beast' Labbett and Darragh 'The Menace' Ennis hoping to win big money. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: Tsunami: The Wave That Shook the World
programme.desc: Documentary examining the 2004 Indian Ocean Boxing Day tsunami. Killing around 230,000 people and displacing 1.4 million more, it was one of the deadliest natural disasters in history. Told through the first-hand experiences of individuals from all over the world, cameras reveal how catastrophic events unfolded during the morning of December 26, 2004. Among them is Rob, an Englishman who conveys the horrifying account of his desperate attempts to rescue his family from a paradise beach in Sri Lanka

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Katy Perry: Night of a Lifetime
programme.desc: The American singer-songwriter hosts a spectacular evening of music and conversation from London's Central Hall Westminster. Watched by a star-studded audience, Katy performs a selection of her greatest hits as well as songs from her latest album, 143

programme.title: TikTok: Top 100 2024
programme.desc: A countdown of the top 100 funniest, most extreme and rudest viral videos of 2024 from TikTok and other social media platforms. Plus, an estimation of how much money the clips made for their creators

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the doors of British factories to find out how they keep shelves stocked, from massive factories making meals in their millions to family firms trading on secret recipes. The first edition celebrates snacks, visiting the Wagon Wheel factory in south Wales making millions of biscuits a year and the Melton Mowbray company responsible for an award-winning pork pie. Plus, how potatoes are taken from the field and turned into crisps in a matter of hours

programme.title: Love Your Exotic Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh takes a look back at memorable exotic gardens created by his team, and the unusual twists the show has put on a challenge. The three projects featured in this special are a tranquil Japanese garden, a Moroccan oasis, and a theatrical Italian masterpiece

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Christmas has well and truly arrived at Manor Farm and bringing the festive cheer are actress Anita Dobson, actor Ben Miller and broadcaster Moira Stuart - with Andy Clarke providing the best in Christmas cocktails. Horticulturist Camilla Bassett-Smith celebrates the season Victorian-style, there is a look at how the animals at Port Lympne and Howletts Zoo spend the big day and Alan meets some special Shetland ponies

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning at Christmas
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen for the final time in 2024 as the festive celebrations continue with guests Russell Watson and Kim Wilde, chefs Paul Ainsworth and Pip Lacey, and master cocktail maker Merlin Griffiths

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner revisit favourite recipes from the show's last few years, starting with brunch dishes of a takeaway-inspired egg and sausage muffin, and chorizo and broken yolk smash. That's followed by two simple traybakes of a haddock and sweetcorn chowder, and a beans and waffle pie, then a veggie lasagne, and beef chow mein with prawn crackers. They finish up with two sweet treats - Lisa's honey and coconut cake and a decadent burnt Basque cheesecake

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: Comedy starring John Candy and Macaulay Culkin. Buck Russell is a fun-loving bachelor without a care in the world. He's also the world's greatest slob. So when he has to look after his sharp young nephew and nieces while their parents are away, anything can - and will - happen.

programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure starring Jeff Goldblum and Julianne Moore. Past experience tells Dr Ian Malcolm not to get involved with businessman John Hammond's new scheme to build a dinosaur park. However, he reluctantly agrees when he realises that his girlfriend is already on site. On his arrival on the secluded island he soon finds that his fears were well founded.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Britain Get Singing
programme.desc: A second outing for the show in which Roman Kemp invites celebrities to take part in a spectacular sing-off while shining a light on mental health. Groups from Good Morning Britain, Love Island, Coronation Street, EastEnders and The Masked Singer compete, with the likes of Kate Garraway, Laura Tobin, Claire Sweeney, Mollie Gallagher, Chris Kamara, Russell Watson, Emma Barton, Heather Peace and Sid Owen performing for a super panel of Will.i.am, Adam Lambert, Alesha Dixon and Jonathan Ross

programme.title: What's on Scotland at Christmas
programme.desc: Festive showbiz fun with celebrity interviews and a guide to the best in seasonal entertainment

programme.title: Deal or No Deal: Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as heptathlete Katarina Johnson-Thompson goes up against the infamous banker - supported by her friends, family and fellow athletes. Can Katarina choose the right boxes and resist the banker's tempting cash offers until just the right moment in order to take home a fortune for her chosen charity?

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune Christmas Special
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts a special festive edition of the classic game show, with actor Richard E Grant, Gavin & Stacey star Joanna Page and TV and radio presenter Tyler West spinning the wheel and trying to solve puzzles and avoid bankruptcy in the hope of winning 50,000 for the charities of their choice

programme.title: Lorraine Kelly: 40 Unforgettable Years
programme.desc: A tribute to the much-loved presenter and journalist who joined TV-am in October 1984, and became one of British TV's most popular broadcasters. Featuring archival footage from Lorraine's early broadcasting career to the present day and interviews with those who know her best
